sect1.title: Tutorials
sect1.para: This section contains three tutorials demonstrating the use of JSure and SureLogic program annotations to assure the correct use of locks in three concurrent programs. The first tutorial uses a small closed-world example to demonstrate the complete assurance of a class and its usage, starting with no annotations at all. The second and third examples begin with a partially annotated program, and demonstrates more sophisticated concepts such as support for java.util.concurrent reader–writer locks.

figure.title: Menu item to install tutorial projects into your workspace

sect1.para: These tutorials assume that you have installed JSure. If you see a JSure menu item on your Eclipse main menu than you can assume it has been installed properly. To follow along with the tutorials you will also need to add the BoundedFIFOJsure and PlanetBaronJSure projects to your workspace. From the Eclipse main menu, choose JSureRun JSure Tutorials and add the projects to your workspace as displayed in and . Note that the PlanetBaronJSure and SimpleVariable projects will not compile without errors until you add the promises JAR file to the project's build path (as described below).
